intro: Rosa communis var. burnatii, commonly known as the Burnatii rose, is a botanical variant of the common rose. It is characterized by its fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and dark green, lobed leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes. This variety is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in perfumery and culinary applications.
